intro: Draba camtschatica, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, Central Asia, and parts of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Draba camtschatica is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
